isis.stitle: AIR COMPRESSOR: HOLSET SS 296 AND QE 296/338 - TESTING

svcproc.title: VEHICLE AIR SYSTEM TESTING
svcproc.para: The vehicle air system can be tested in accordance with FMVSS121 standards by doing a simple performance test as follows:

Bleed the air system gauges down to approximately 60 psi, then with the engine running at full governed speed (no load, no air accessories being used), the compressor should pump the brake system reservoirs from 85 to 100 psi in 25 seconds or less.

If the compressor fails to pump the tanks from 85 to 100 psi in 25 seconds, then determine if any extra capacity reservoirs have been installed on the vehicle or if the engine RPM (Maximum governed) is lower than specification. If reservoir total volume and engine RPM are per original vehicle manufacturer's specifications, then system plumbing leakage must be checked.
